reviews.review_msg: Not a GPA booster but learned a lot in his class. A superb & engaging lecturer. PSAs are definitely an area that you have to work for. There is an expectation for students to dig deeper than what might be on the surface of the documents. Paul wrote me a paragraph on things I can work on. It really helped. Makes me more confident to write PSAs

He is an amazing prof. His lectures are very clear and easy to follow. He helps to build a good undestanding of how to approach material. If he throws a info session before the final, it would be helpful to come+(it's bonus mark, even though it's optional). He grades fairly and provide interesting PSAs to read. He helps to approach PSAs analysis
He's a good prof, knows his stuff, and is very passionate about the subject he teaches. He marks tough, but fair. Be prepared to read a lot.

By far the most organized prof I have ever had. Especially for a history course, he is organized, knows how to talk in lectures (not boring at all), and clear with his expectations. Although PSA's can be challenging, you still enjoy the course and feel that he's helpful. I HIGHLY recommend taking a course with him! Never came across a great prof.
Great professor!
An excellent professor who has both the passion for history and the ability to teach history. However, he is not the most generous when it comes to giving grades.

Garfinkel is great, he knows his stuff, articulates it well and directs his course to you being able to do well on his exams and papers. Don't skip class and definitely do the tutorial readings, otherwise you may be left in the dark very easily.
I love Professor Garfinkel!!!
smart, interesting guy. loved the lectures and tutorials. even better, he's down to earth, easy to talk to, very approachable and friendly. he's not the easiest prof. but also not the hardest

Good lectures, no overheads, a lot of statistics and demographics.  He couldn't lead a tutorial to save his life, but as a lecturer, he was very good in from of the class.  His marking was pretty hard as well, and he lets you know he used to teach at Harvard like 8 times in the first week.

Talks very quicky with no overheads. be prepared to take lots of notes! seems to enjoy hearing himself talk, can go off on tangents. difficult marker, willing to help but expects a LOT. wouldn't recommend

She's a good prof, and her lectures are interesting. But she doesn't use a text book or have lecture recordings so you have to go lecture in order to understand anything. Extremely hard on attendance, takes attendance during lecture! But very approachable.

Dr. Bidnall is really cool! She makes a very dry course content interesting by putting it in laymen's terms and relating it to modern events. It was a shame she doesnt teach her own tutorials, as my TA wasnt the best. I really enjoyed Dr. Bidnall as a prof and i look forward to taking more classes with her :)
Great Lecturer! Loves what shes teaching.

Amanda is a great prof with a real passion for History. Her lectures are interesting and engaging. She is extremely helpful and very approachable. Her lecture style makes class enjoyable for every one and course readings, for the most part , were interesting and worthwhile.

One of the most caring professors ever. Very passionate. Cool lectures and very accessible outside class. I would say make sure to attend, otherwise kinda hard to catch up since the course does not mirror the textbook, which is pretty much only for quizzes and general info. Course is generally chill, but not unreasonably easy, so pay some attention

First semester with her and I quite like her lecturing style and the breakdown of assignments. Decent quizzes based on the textbook and sometimes additional reading(s) which occasionally seemed like a lot but were still very doable with or without taking notes. She's generally engaging which is nice and brought us cookies on the last lecture!

Had a breakdown after 10 students AI-generated an essay, and completely reorganized the course grading system, made all assignments significantly harder and made all at-home assignments mandatory to be completed in-class. Do not take if you do not LOVE writing essays in-class.
Awesome prof!
No Comments
No Comments
Hated the class, but prof was nice and lectures were interesting

I believe he needs to learn how to not read off lecture notes from a piece of paper. He would read to fast and there would not be enough time to write your thoughts and then he would be on a different topic. I know this is not his area of research and I will give him that but come on.. When a class wants slides for main points DO IT.Final Exam:HARD
SFU must be really desperate for a teacher to be hiring this guy.  Really cannot teach.  Like REALLY!
her lectures are clear and interesting! she is really passionate about the subjects. she is ready for extra help and cares about all students.
Worst prof ive had. Can't lecture/understand him.

Vinkovetsky is a decent prof. Not the best lecturer, so lectures aren't particularly fluid or clear. Try your best to take notes though because the 224 textbook, Barricades & Borders, isn't great - too focused on minute details. Tests are mainly about broader themes w/ facts used as evidence. He likes to focus on the Ottoman Empire and Balkans.

I am a first year and it was a really overwhelming course. There is a lot to read and are difficult readings. Though the TAs helped a lot with what the tests would look like. The tests are based on the readings and lectures. He bounces around a lot, talks fast, says he will send the slides but never does. There is a lot of topics covered too.

Ilya's lectures are very tough to understand, not because of his his slight accent, but because he jumps around chronologically making it almost impossible to take helpful notes by hand. He also doesn't use powerpoint at all, so you have to write really fast to keep up with him, and his lectures are dull.

It can be too much readings at time. Not the best lecturer. He's a nice guy, tries to be as clear as possible. If you do all the readings, attend class and pay attention during lectures should be fine. Exams are straight foward.
Prof. Vinkovetsky is an excellent professor. He does give at times too much reading, but will help students through it with weekly questions and discussions.
very very nice man! lectures are unorganized and sooo much reading. Gives lots of notes in emails, tries to keep things fun, marks fairly hard
